attributes.action: Do Not Raise The Energy Price Cap
attributes.additional_details: The public are already paying the highest price in history, for their domestic gas and electricity. Raising the energy price cap again this October will force the elderly and those on lower incomes to choose between heating their homes, or putting food on the table. This is totally unacceptable, and OFGEM cannot justify raising the price cap any further in 2022. The large ‘big six’ energy companies are reporting record profits in the region of billions of pounds, so a rise is wholly unjustified.
attributes.background: The Energy Price Cap (Gas & Electricity) is due to rise again on 1st October 2022, by an estimated 42% (Source: OFGEM 24.05.22). This will push millions of people into fuel poverty. Another price cap rise in 2022 is completely unjustified, especially when we are facing a cost of living crisis.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The energy cap is set by Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament.

You might like to sign the following petitions, which call for related actions:

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915
